item.title: Report E-2023110080
item.description:
Report E-2023110080

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. HES utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the site.

item.title: Report E-2023110057
item.description:
Report E-2023110057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: TUNNEL HILL
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 24, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was damaged during loading and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Marion Environmental (ME) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail and placed it in one (1) 30-gallon drum for transport to the local RLC terminal to be moved to the facilities waste consolidation area. ME personnel utilized absorbent pads to remove free product from the trailer floor and deployed granular absorbents to collect any residual product. All paint impacted material was collected in one (1) poly trash bag and ME took possession of the waste.

item.title: Report X-2023100552
item.description:
Report X-2023100552

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: AUGUSTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer door was opened and notice the hazmat package at the front. Box was wet but was not sure if it was because of the hazmat or another package. A certified Ops Admin was called on radio to retrieve package and inspect. Package was placed in a plastic and hazmat bag. Hazmat was inspected and realized that package was wet because of internal damaaged. DescribePack: just wet box due to top loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: given to QA Ops Admin to retrieve and inspect.

item.title: Report X-2023100521
item.description:
Report X-2023100521

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: BRASELTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Plastic pail found on its side heavily leaking from the top. Upon inspection, the seal at the top cap was loose and leaking as well as a crack on the top (probably from drop) was also leaking. Spill cleaned with proper PPE and placed in salvage drum. DescribePack: the seal at the top cap was loose and leaking as well as a crack on the top was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill cleaned with proper PPE and placed in salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023081773
item.description:
Report X-2023081773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-19
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Aug 18th a package was discovered at the station during the PM sort that had no markings on the outside of the package. An employee under manager supervision was instructed to open the package and discovered five packages of UN3480 Lithium Ion Batteries, 9 inside the box. DG Admin instructed the employee to open the inner packages to determine if there was any contact info but there is not. At this point, we do not know who the shipper or consignee are for this shipment. The package is being held at the station pending disposition.
